image.altText: Students walk in a protest carrying signs. One signs reads 'Ceasefire now'.

props.synopsis: ANU Vice-Chancellor Genevieve Bell did not say if security consultants monitored pro-Palestinian students' social media activity.

title.children: ANU spent almost $1 million responding to pro-Palestinian student protests, Vice-Chancellor says

image.altText: A white statue in the centre of the picture, surrounded by sandstone and stained glass windows behind

props.synopsis: A Catholic diocese successfully appeals the compensation in a landmark civil case brought by a sexual abuse survivor, reducing its payout by more than $1 million.Â

title.children: Catholic diocese successfully appeals landmark $3.3m payout to victim survivor

image.altText: A white alpaca on a lead, held by a man in a black polo, is stroked on the neck by an elder woman in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: Though the world may remember Hephner for his unforgettable sneeze on King Charles, the alpaca has already made a name for himself around Canberra through many philanthropic endeavours.

title.children: Why Hephner the alpaca makes regular visits to those in palliative care

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: A Peruvian catfisher who committed sexual offences against two Canberra women, after luring them with a fake Tinder identity, is sentenced to nine months jail by the ACT Magistrates Court.

title.children: Man who lured two women using fake Tinder identity is sentenced to nine months in Canberra jail

image.altText: A streetview of a shopping centre.

props.synopsis: A police officer is suspended with pay over the charges, which stem from an incident at a Batemans Bay shopping centre.

image.altText: Andrew Barr stands at a podium, flanked by colleagues.

props.synopsis: Andrew Barr unveils the new ACT Legislative Assembly cabinet and promises an overhaul of the public service to improve government services.Â

title.children: Andrew Barr announces new cabinet and overhaul of ACT public service

image.altText: A concrete building with lettering above the entrance reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory".

props.synopsis: Canberra man Justin James, accused of supplying heroin to a 23-year-old woman who later died, is denied bail for three charges of drug trafficking and one of illegal weapon possession.

title.children: Canberra man accused of supplying heroin to woman who later died faces drug trafficking charges

image.altText: students walk around at the university of canberra

props.synopsis: With jobs to be cut at both of Canberra's major universities, some staff members are concerned about the way the process has been handled so far by management.

title.children: 'There's a sense of shock': Difficult times ahead for universities in Australia's knowledge capital

image.altText: Four men hold beers while smiling at the camera for a selfie while sitting in a stadium

props.synopsis: The ABC has spoken to Israelis who say they were attacked by people who asked if they were Jewish in Amsterdam after a match between Maccabi Tel Aviv and Ajax.

title.children: 'Anti-Semitic hit-and-run squad' attacks leaves Israeli soccer fans scrambling to leave Amsterdam, vowing to never return

image.altText: Australian dollar notes and Chinese Yuan.

props.synopsis:
Stella says she had no idea she was involved in an international money laundering operation until a text message from China warned her bank account there had been frozen.

image.altText: A tree whose trunk has been twisted.

title.children: Hundreds of modified trees on outback property described as a 'national treasure'

image.altText: A woman holds up a sign showing a tombstone with the words "Roe 1973-2022".

props.synopsis: Abortion and reproductive rights have been a divisive issue in the United States since Roe v Wade was overturned by the Supreme Court in 2022 and figured heavily in the election campaign.

image.altText: Mary Senuta wears a black 'Trump' cap while standing at a bar in a function room.

image.altText: John Bingham, dressed in a suit sits on a bed behind his future wife in a dress and sweater.

props.synopsis: Wealthy aristocrat Lord Lucan was accused of killing his nanny and attacking his wife inside his London home. But after half a century of speculation about his whereabouts, his female victims have been forgotten.Â

title.children: How a British aristocrat accused of murdering his children's nanny vanished into thin air

image.altText: Beyonce smiles and waves.

image.altText: Uncle Moogy Sumner AM

title.children: 'Another one of our old people coming back home': Human remains traded for prehistoric animal parts returned to Australia

image.altText: A cute native bee with vivid blue bands on its back.

props.synopsis: A Victorian woman was left waiting three hours for an ambulance while suffering a potentially catastrophic brain bleed, amid the state's ongoing ambulance crisis.

title.children: Paramedic says mother lucky to survive after three-hour wait for ambulance

image.altText: man in navy in wheelchair  shirt speaks to press

props.synopsis: Two survivors of a bombing that killed 22 people at the close of an Ariana Grande concert seven years ago have been awarded Â£45,000 ($AU88,000) in damages after successfully suing a conspiracy theorist who claimed the attack was staged.

title.children: Manchester bombing survivors awarded thousands in damages after harassment by conspiracy theorist

image.altText: A sticker saying ABORTION ACCESS IS A COMMUNITY RESPONSIBILITY over a heart, stuck on a blue sign

title.children: NSW Health Minister says abortion services at Orange Hospital will be restored after executive restricted access

image.altText: An eroded plaster body of a human sits on a table in front of a red and white fresco

props.synopsis: An international study has found assumptions on the sex and relationships of individuals found in the ruins of the ancient Roman city buried in a volcanic eruption were not based on scientific evidence.

title.children: DNA testing reveals Pompeii residents weren't who they were thought to be

image.altText: a close up of a large white blimp flying over forest

title.children: The sky-high plan for massive airships to deliver cargo across the outback

image.altText: A close up photo of a man with an eyepatch covering one eye.

image.altText: In the foreground, a child on their parent's back. In the background, a crowd. A giant plume of smoke rises above them

image.altText: A damaged room at the new Darwin youth justice centre

title.children: Six youths cause up to $200,000 in damage to new Darwin detention centre in 30-minute window between routine checks

image.altText: outside Newcastle courthouse.

image.altText: Lisa Govan in a tank top.

title.children: Woman missing for 25 years in outback WA seen on back of slain bikie's Harley on morning she vanished, inquest told

props.synopsis: We've only got two US election questions this week, hope you paid attention to the rest of the news.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A giant crocodile, the Melbourne Cup, and a little bit of Trump
